Articles.Content:
Hello, try to create space craft and send a screenshot! please vote for some body

goals:

.probe 5+

.1 manned ship 10+

.2 manned ship 15+

.3 manned ship 20+

.nuclear engines used 2+

.docking used 25+

.step by step= first go to the mun then to duna then to laythe 75+

.apollo style 15+

.buran/space shuttle style 25+

.fairings 10+

.space shuttle like flight (plane only and get back to KSC) 200+

post goals:

.video 10+

.screenshot 5+

.more screenshot or video,s 15+

fails:

.land in laythe ocean= boat is 5+ land is -5

.killed kerbals -2

.landed on another planet 25-

.used mods like hyperedit 5-

.used extra feul mods 20-

.reply about other stuff BAN!

.fakes 0

.noobship 10-

missions:

A.creating a nice ship and fly to layhte 40+

B.create your own mission costum points

c.creating a plane to layhte 280+

VOTE FOR THESE GUYS:

it stops when 0.22 is out LETS START IT!

WIN! 0.22 FOR FREE!

Edited July 28, 2013 by jbaltus123

A few questions:

1. Are mods allowed? (.fairings 10+)

2. Please define "noobship" (.noobship 10-)

3. Does "Creating a plane to laythe" mean flying an SSTO there with no refuellings, or carrying a plane on a rocket and flying it in the Laythe atmosphere?

I'm soon going to stream marooning jeb on laythe purposely. I don't want him to come back. I'm sending him in a plane mounted to an asymetrical lift system. will this count, or be disqualified because I don't bring him back? I plan on doing some slingshots to get out there too.

1. yes!

2. a ship maded by noobs

3.use nuclear enngines and air engines!

I landed in the ocean and then took off and landed on land as well, how do the points work for that?

Poseidon in Jool orbit

Poseidon in Laythe orbit

Trigono 1's descent

Trigono 1 landing in the ocean and on land

Trigono 1 flying from ocean landing spot to land

Trigono 1 returning to Poseidon

Leaving Laythe and the Jool system

Poseidon returning to Kerbin

I think Brotoro would win this one. He's built a good base there, explored extensively, and recorded pics of it with some very nice story telling along the way. Yeah, OK, doesn't meet the parts compliment I know, but I just had to put that in

About the ''noob ship'' thing, I have several things to say/ask.

How do you define a noob? Because noob means new player. Or are you using the widely used definition of a bad player?

On another defining note, how new must the player be? 1 month? 2? 1 week? This is something really hard to define.

And why penalize them? I thought challenges were made so players could challenge themselves, and making themselves better at whatever the challenge involved. If you penalize a player for being new, doesn't that make sure new players won't play the challenge?

This is a subject that really grinds my gears, but I tried to calm as possible.
Wouldn't landing on another planet or moon and THEN going to Laythe be worth more points? Also the Noobship thing doesn't make too much sense.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Oh well, I guess I'll just leave this here

Crew: 4 but it can carry 12 kerbs at once.

Just got back from Laythe not so long ago, here's the vacation video.

Cupcake...
There's only a set point deduction for using Hyperedit? So can I just build a ship that accomplishes everything, hyperedit it to Laythe, and still get a ton of points?

a bad player

Define "Bad Player" & "noob-ship".

As far as I can tell you're just being intentionally horrible. You sound like an internet yob.

I may try this later but this "noob-ship" thing is really putting me off..

So, what if I build a ship that can do everything in your challenge, and persistence-edit it to Laythe? It's an automatic win.

Also, what is a bad player for you? Getting to Laythe is pretty difficult for some, so no "no0bz" will try this challenge.

(And check your spelling.)

Gosh, This is such a poor challenge...

"Extra feul mods." WTF is that? Like, mods that add extra fuel tanks? Kethane?

"Noobship". Dude, doing a 3-Man expedition to Laythe isn't THAT easy. If someone accomplishes that, he isn't a noob.

"Step by Step". What about Minmus, Ike, And Dres?

I'm starting to believe you're the real n00b here.
